thread.title: Amy, Chuck Schumer speak for gun control
thread.title_full: Amy, Chuck Schumer speak for gun control - POLITICO

author: Seung Min Kim
title: Amy, Chuck Schumer speak for gun control
text:
Actress and comedian Amy Schumer and her cousin, Sen. Chuck Schumer, joined forces for the second time in New York City to urge residents to take action through social media and traditional advocacy to help tighten gun laws. The senator and his famous cousin appeared outside City Hall in Manhattan on Sunday to promote their “crusade against guns,” the Associated Press reported. The two pressed the public to write, call and use Twitter and Facebook to help halt the nation’s rate of gun violence.
The relatives first held a press conference in New York in August to showcase the senator's draft proposal intended to stop violent criminals, abusers and those with mental illnesses from obtaining guns.
Sen. Schumer enlists famous cousin Amy to pitch guns bill By Seung Min Kim
The initial conference followed the gun violence at a movie theater in Lafayette, Lousiana earlier in the summer at the showing of “Trainwreck,” a movie in which Amy Schumer starred. The shooting killed two women and injured at least nine others.
“If there is anything that the mass shootings in Lafayette, Chattanooga, Charleston, Virginia Tech, Aurora, Sandy Hook and so many other places have taught us, it’s that we should be do everything in our power to prevent weapons from falling into the hands of hateful evil-doers and the mentally ill,” she stated at the time.
